revised_title: The Role of Activated ras Genes in Tumour Growth and Transformation
tldr: The article discusses the involvement of activated ras genes in determining the transformed phenotype of cancer cells. The authors found that cells with mutant ras genes produce transforming growth factor-alpha (TGF-alpha), which contributes to the transformed phenotype. Additionally, the presence of a mutant ras gene in a tumour can lead to tumour progression towards a more aggressive phenotype.
